description: From an unknown West African language, probably Igbo ọ́kụ̀rụ̀ but cf. Akan ŋkrũmã and ŋkrakra (“broth”).

entries.meaning: The edible immature mucilaginous seed pod (properly, capsule) of the Abelmoschus esculentus.
examples: ...as a food easy of digestion may well be admitted likewise the young Ocra an agreeable Food as well for the species as individual, dressed variously according to pleasure...

entries.meaning: The flowering mallow plant Abelmoschus esculentus itself, now commonly grown in the tropics and warmer parts of the temperate zones.
examples: Ocra, this has a round green stem, which rises straight up to ten or twelve foot high.
